Introduction

To standardize the internal USPS application, the stylesheet for Bootstrap 4 has been rebranded to fit with the company style guide. It is recommended for applications to use this stylesheet.

Getting Started

Import the library and build as shown below:


<html>
    <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8">
        <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
        <title>USPS Bootstrap Demo</title>
        <!-- USPS Styling -->
        <link href="usps-bootstrap/dist/usps.bootstrap-4.0.0.css" rel="stylesheet">
        <link href="usps-bootstrap/dist/usps.styles-1.0.0.css" rel="stylesheet">
    </head>
    <body>
        ...
        <!-- Required scripts -->
        <script src="usps-bootstrap/lib/jquery-3.2.1.min.js"></script>
        <script src="usps-bootstrap/lib/popper.min.js"></script>
        <script src="usps-bootstrap/lib/bootstrap-4.0.0.js"></script>
    </body>
</html>

Note that we do not use bootstrap's stylesheet and instead our own. The stylesheet has been generated and serves to replace the default bootstrap stylesheet.

usps.bootstrap-4.0.0.css should not be directly modified. This file was generated and could be overwritten.
usps.styles-1.0.0.css will be maintained and updated as time goes on. Version will be updated as changes are made.

Collapse

Content for Accordion Panel 1
Content for Accordion Panel 2
Content for Accordion Panel 3

Notes

Uses "card" styles for the heaader 

	<div id="accordion">
	<div class="card">
		<div class="card-header" id="headingOne">
			<h5 class="mb-0">
				<button class="btn btn-link" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#collapseOne" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="collapseOne">
					Collapsible Group Item #1
				</button>
			</h5>
		</div>
		<div id="collapseOne" class="collapse show" aria-labelledby="headingOne" data-parent="#accordion">
			<div class="card-body">
				Content for Accordion Panel 1 
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="card">
		<div class="card-header" id="headingTwo">
			<h5 class="mb-0">
				<button class="btn btn-link collapsed" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#collapseTwo" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
					Collapsible Group Item #2
				</button>
			</h5>
		</div>
		<div id="collapseTwo" class="collapse" aria-labelledby="headingTwo" data-parent="#accordion">
			<div class="card-body">
				Content for Accordion Panel 2
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="card">
		<div class="card-header" id="headingThree">
			<h5 class="mb-0">
				<button class="btn btn-link collapsed" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#collapseThree" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseThree">
					Collapsible Group Item #3
				</button>
			</h5>
		</div>
		<div id="collapseThree" class="collapse" aria-labelledby="headingThree" data-parent="#accordion">
			<div class="card-body">
				Content for Accordion Panel 3
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>


Chart Colors

The following colors can be used in charts, dashboards, or any other situations where multiple colors are needed to show complex data. All of these colors have been tested together for users suffering from protanopia and deuteranopia color blindness. Also, the foreground, background color combinations all meet the 4.5:1 contrast ration set by the WCAG and are 508 compliant.

To pick a color pallete for your application simply add 'chart-color' followed by a number 1-18. 
<div class="chart-color1"> </div>

chart-color1
chart-color2
chart-color3
chart-color4
chart-color5
chart-color6
chart-color7
chart-color8
chart-color9
chart-color10
chart-color11
chart-color12
chart-color13
chart-color14
chart-color15
chart-color16
chart-color17
color-blind18

Notes

The SCSS and hex codeds for this pallete are as follows: 

	$chart-color1: $tan;
	$chart-color2: $red;
	$chart-color3: $orange;
	$chart-color4: $gold;
	$chart-color5: $green;
	$chart-color6: $teal;
	$chart-color7: $blue;
	$chart-color8: $lavender;
	$chart-color9: $violet;
	$chart-color10: darken($tan, 24%);
	$chart-color11: darken($red, 24%);
	$chart-color12: darken($orange, 24%);
	$chart-color13: darken($gold, 24%);
	$chart-color14: darken($green, 24%);
	$chart-color15: darken($teal, 24%);
	$chart-color16: darken($blue, 24%);
	$chart-color17: darken($lavender, 24%);
	$chart-color18: darken($violet, 24%);

Jumbotron

Hello, world!

This is a simple hero unit, a simple jumbotron-style component for calling extra attention to featured content or information.

It uses utility classes for typography and spacing to space content out within the larger container.

Learn more



Nav (Tabs)

Basic Example
<ul class="nav nav-tabs">
  • Active Tab 1
  • Tab 2
  • Disabled Tab
  • Dropdown Tab
    Dropdown Link 1 Dropdown Link 2
    Separated Link 3
Content in Tab Panel 1
Content 2
Dropdown content#1
Dropdown content#2
Dropdown content#3
Full Width (Justified) Example
<ul class="nav nav-tabs nav-justified">
  • Active
  • Link
  • Link
  • Disabled

Gray

<ul class="nav nav-tabs nav-justified" usps-style="gray">
  • National
  • Capital Metro
  • Eastern
  • Great Lakes
  • Northeast
  • Pacific
  • Southern
  • Western

Tables


Standard
<table class="table">
# First Last Handle
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Light Header
<thead class="thead-light">
# First Last Handle
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Stripped Table
<table class="table table-stripped">
# First Last Handle
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

class="Dark Stripped Table"
<table class="table-stripped table-dark">
# First Last Handle
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter
Dark
<table class="table-dark">
# First Last Handle
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Dark Header
<thead class="thead-dark">"
# First Last Handle
1 Mark Otto @mdo
2 Jacob Thornton @fat
3 Larry the Bird @twitter

Heading 4

Heading 5

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis, sem. Nulla consequat massa quis enim. Donec pede justo, fringilla vel, aliquet nec, vulputate eget, arcu. In enim justo, rhoncus ut, imperdiet a, venenatis vitae, justo. Nullam dictum felis eu pede mollis pretium

Notes

To use the default text color instead of postal blue, add the "gray" class to your headers 
<h1 class="gray">
